DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from pathologic information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for breast carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment of a neoplasm of the breast based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)_Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that the extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

Concepts.definition: The extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1.  M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1.  M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIC includes: Any T, N3, M0.  N3: Metastases in ipsilateral infraclavicular (level III) axillary lymph nodes(s) with or without level I, II axillary lymph node involvement; or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary lymph node(s) with clinically evident level I, II axillary lymph node metastases; or metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph node(s) with or without axillary or internal mammary lymph node involvement.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIC Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIC includes: Any T, N3, M0.  N3: Metastases in ipsilateral infraclavicular (level III) axillary lymph nodes(s) with or without level I, II axillary lymph node involvement; or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary lymph node(s) with clinically evident level I, II axillary lymph node metastases; or metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph node(s) with or without axillary or internal mammary lymph node involvement.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (T4, N0, M0); (T4, N1, M0); (T4, N2, M0).  T4: Tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or to the skin (ulceration or skin nodules).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N2: Metastases in ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph nodes that are clinically fixed or matted; or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of clinically evident axillary lymph node metastases.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T4, N0, M0); (T4, N1, M0); (T4, N2, M0).  T4: Tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or to the skin (ulceration or skin nodules).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N2: Metastases in ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph nodes that are clinically fixed or matted; or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of clinically evident axillary lymph node metastases.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: (T0, N2, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N1, M0); (T3, N2, M0).  T0: No evidence of primary tumor.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T2: Tumor more than 20 mm but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N2: Metastases in ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph nodes that are clinically fixed or matted; or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of clinically evident axillary lymph node metastases.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: (T0, N2, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N1, M0); (T3, N2, M0).  T0: No evidence of primary tumor.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T2: Tumor more than 20 mm but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N2: Metastases in ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph nodes that are clinically fixed or matted; or in clinically detected ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of clinically evident axillary lymph node metastases.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: (T2, N1, M0); (T3, N0, M0).  T2: Tumor more than 20 mm but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIB Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: (T2, N1, M0); (T3, N0, M0).  T2: Tumor more than 20 mm but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: (T0, N1, M0); (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N0, M0).  T0: No evidence of primary tumor.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension. T2: Tumor more than 20 mm but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIA Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: (T0, N1, M0); (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N0, M0).  T0: No evidence of primary tumor.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension. T2: Tumor more than 20 mm but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension.  N1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: (T0, N1mi, M0); (T1, N1mi, M0).  T0: No evidence of primary tumor.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension.  N1mi: Nodal micrometastases.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IB Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: (T0, N1mi, M0); (T1, N1mi, M0).  T0: No evidence of primary tumor.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension.  N1mi: Nodal micrometastases.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: T1, N0, M0.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IA Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: T1, N0, M0.  T1: Tumor 20 mm or less in greatest dimension.  T1 includes T1mi. T1mi: Tumor 1 mm or less in greatest dimension.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis.  M0 includes M0(i+).  (AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage 0 Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VMD with latest version of NCIt concept defintion. mc 3/20/12

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Breast Cancer TNM Finding v7 American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage Grouping Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
